"Your next sensor reading will reflect the calibration you just entered.
You can see your calibrations in the History tab's event log."
Add a short note to help you keep track of a health event or a change in your glucose management that might affect your glucose
Notes will be processed by Dexcom in accordance with our Privacy Policy. For more information about privacy, view our
"MDSS-UK RP LIMITED 6 Wilmslow Road, Rusholme, Manchester M14 5TP United Kingdom "
We are unable to verify the compatibility of your phone with the Dexcom ONE CGM system at this time. Please make sure that your phone is connected to the internet.

"We are unable to verify the compatibility of your phone with the Dexcom G7 CGM system at this time.
Please make sure that your phone is connected to the internet."
All people ages 2 years and older
Can use the abdomen or back of arm
After setup, you can customize alert settings in Profile > Alerts.
Dexcom ONE alerts will NOT override your phone settings.
You will NOT hear or feel alerts if your phone is set to silent.
Alerts you when your sensor reading is at or above the set level.
Alerts you when your sensor reading is at or above this level.
"It's the yellow line on the glucose graph."
Alerts you when your sensor reading is at or below the set level.
Alerts you when your sensor reading is at or below this level.
"It's the red line on the glucose graph."
Depending on the phone sound settings, alerts will vibrate or sound.

"When phone sound is on: Alert sounds.
When phone sound is off: Alerts vibrate first, but will sound if you haven't acknowledged them."

"Each alert is set to the default. Tap any alert to customize.
If you want to schedule when this profile is used, tap "Scheduling.
Tap profile to view and edit settings.
Your new alert profile is here.
Tap circle to turn on a profile.
Your original profile is now named
Your alert schedule has been activated.
Use the alert schedule to automatically switch on your %1$s alert profile at days and times you set.
Your High alert setting must be at least %1$s more than your Low alert setting.
Alerts you when your sensor reading is at or above the set level.
Alerts when your sensor reading is at or above this level.
Your Low alert setting must be at least %1$s less than your High alert setting.
Alerts you when your sensor reading is at or below the set level.
Alerts when your sensor reading is at or below this level.
The yellow line on your graph shows your High alert setting.
The red line shows your Low alert setting.
Urgent Low lets you know when your glucose is at or below %1$s %2$s.
Sound is also in use for:
Alert will sound regardless of phone settings.
Alert will sound regardless of phone settings.
"Brief Sensor Issue won't sound when your phone sound settings are off."
"Signal Loss won't sound when your phone sound settings are off."
Brief Sensor Issue will only vibrate even if your phone sound settings are on.
Signal Loss will only vibrate even if your phone sound settings are on.
Choose how your alert notifies you: sound, vibrate, or match phone settings.
* Silence All Quiet Mode is on. It overrides your Sound/Vibrate setting.
* Vibrate Quiet Mode is on. It overrides your Sound/Vibrate setting.
Alert will vibrate regardless of phone settings.
"Alerts will vibrate first, but then sound if you haven't acknowledged them."
Alerts let you know when your glucose goes too high or low.
You can create a second alert profile with customized alerts. More information" "
You can create a second alert profile with customized alerts. For example, a nighttime or work profile. You can switch between or schedule profiles.
Two more alerts are Urgent Low and Urgent Low Soon.
"Alerts you when your sensor reading is %1$s %2$s or below. This can't be changed or turned off."
Always keep phone within %1$s of sensor.

"The app needs Nearby Devices permission for Bluetooth to work. Bluetooth sends your sensor readings to the app.
On the next screen, "Allow Nearby Devices permission for Dexcom so you get sensor readings and alerts.
Bluetooth needs Nearby Devices permission so you get sensor readings and alerts.
You will get sensor readings and alerts.
Bluetooth always needs app location permission to get your sensor readings and alerts.
Dexcom needs to confirm your country of residence.
To get sensor readings and alerts Bluetooth needs app Location Permission.
Turn on notifications to get all your alerts.
You will receive notifications. Dexcom recommends keeping notifications on so you can get alerts.
You will receive alerts. Dexcom recommends keeping notifications on so you get your alerts.
The average of all the glucose readings in the selected date range.

"Battery optimizing is off so app can run in the background.
Your alerts won't be delayed."

"Battery optimizing is off so app can run in the background.
Your alerts, and information sent to Followers, won't be delayed."

"Alerts may be delayed because battery optimizing is on. This prevents the app from running in the background.
Tap button below, then "turn off battery optimizing mode.

"Alerts may be delayed because battery optimizing is on. This prevents the app from running in the background.
If you're using Share, information sent to Followers may also be delayed.
Tap button below, then "turn off battery optimizing mode.
Alerts may be delayed because battery optimizing is on. This prevents the app from running in the background.
You can only calibrate when you are getting sensor readings.
BG Meter Value Out of Range
Turn on Bluetooth to get readings and alerts.
Turn on the Nearby Devices permission.
"Alerts you when the sensor can't read your glucose right now."
"Patch isn't peeling off. For better adhesion, use overpatch or medical tape."
Nothing is pressing on the sensor, like a waistband or seatbelt.
Transmitter is snapped flat in its holder
Brief Sensor Issue" lets you know there's a temporary issue with your sensor, and you aren't getting sensor readings."
Your sensor has a temporary issue. This issue can happen anytime, especially in the first 24 hours of inserting a new sensor. It usually fixes itself within 3 hours.
Don’t remove sensor. Use BG meter for treatment decisions.
"Check your sensor and transmitter. Make sure:"
If Brief Sensor Issue continues for more than 3 hours, contact technical support.
"Don't get alert until Brief Sensor Issue lasts this long. Select a time between 20 and 60 minutes."
"No readings or alerts. Don't remove sensor."
Don’t remove sensor. Temporary issue. Wait up to 3 hours.
For support, use overpatch or medical tape
Your calibration is in progress. Your next sensor reading will reflect your calibration.

"G7 couldn't calibrate using the BG meter value you entered at %s. To give your glucose and the sensor time to adjust, try calibrating again in about an hour using a new fingerstick.
To get an accurate BG meter value, follow these steps:
1. Wash your hands with soap and water 2. Dry your hands 3. Take a fingerstick"
"You can't take a photo without camera access."
Share cannot be used until consent is restored.
You’ve revoked consent to data sharing
"Once stopped, you can't restart your sensor."
This will cancel searching for sensor.

"Your sensor is paired to another phone. Sensors can only be paired to one phone.
To change phones: "
"1. Unpair or delete app from old phone "
3. Tap OK, then Start New Sensor
Check your internet connection and try again. If this happens again, contact tech support.
You can change this later in Profile > Alerts.

Dexcom Clarity highlights your glucose patterns, trends and statistics.

a. Wash hands and site with soap and water. Dry.
b. Scrub site with an alcohol wipe. Let dry.
a. Clean transmitter with alcohol wipe.
To get sensor readings and alerts, Bluetooth needs app Location Permission.
Bluetooth needs app Location Permission to get your sensor readings and alerts.
The graph and sensor reading background colors show where your glucose is.
When your glucose goes high, they turn yellow.
Low or heading toward %1$s %2$s fast? They turn red.
"%1$s won't work unless you enable Google Play services."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are missing from your device."
%1$s is having trouble with Google Play services. Please try again.
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are not supported by your device."
"%1$s won't run unless you update Google Play services."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are currently updating."
New version of Google Play services needed. It will update itself shortly.

Your app will show your sensor readings in mg/dL.
Your app will show your sensor readings in mmol/L.

Dexcom server issue. Try again later.
Dexcom needs your consent to select and use certain products and services in this app.
Tap Continue to review and update your consent. You can change your choices at any time.
Data consent required to turn on Share.
Continue to start a new sensor.
This app is invalid, and all features are disabled at this time. Please contact Dexcom for more information.
Warning! Please contact Dexcom for more information. Accepting this warning message will allow you to continue using the App, however there may be a known issue with some functionality.

Delay first alert until your sensor reading is high for this long.
Only notify your Follower with the %1$s notification after this amount of time.

Bluetooth on your smart device is off. Bluetooth must be on in order to get glucose information on your smart device.
Exit this app. Tap Settings > Bluetooth and turn Bluetooth to on.
Your recent calibration was not accepted.
Enter a new blood glucose reading to recalibrate your sensor.
Your recent calibration was not accepted.
Enter a new blood glucose reading to recalibrate your sensor after

"Your recent calibration was not accepted.
Enter a new blood glucose reading to recalibrate your sensor in 15 min."
At the beginning of your sensor session you will need to take two fingerSticks with your meter.
"Enter your blood glucose readings into either the app or receiver. You don't need to enter the readings into both."
Make sure your transmitter is snapped into your sensor pod.
If No Readings continues for more than 3 hours, contact Tech Support.
You will not receive alerts, alarms, or sensor glucose readings.
Use your blood glucose meter for treatment decisions.
If the sensor error continues for more than 30 minutes, contact Tech Support.
The time has been changed on this smart device. Please wait up to 10 minutes while the Dexcom CGM adjusts to the new time.
The Adjusting Clock warning will go away as soon as the adjustment is finished.
Make sure your transmitter is properly inserted into your sensor pod.
If the error continues, go to Menu > Settings > Transmitter > Pair new to go through the pairing process again.
Avoid barriers between your transmitter and smart device. Keep them within 20 feet of each other
It may take up to 30 minutes to reconnect.
Are you sure you want to disconnect and stop sharing data with Google Fit?
Get your glucose information on your phone or Dexcom receiver or both.
"These phone features can prevent the app from working. The app can't alert you about these phone features."
Dexcom ONE gives you your sensor readings and if it is trending up or down.
Estimated A1C (eA1C) approximates the laboratory A1C level. Requires a minimum set of sensor readings over 12 days.

Below the event name is the time and sensor reading when you saved it.
Use events to track your insulin doses, BG meter values, meals, activity or add information. If you choose to calibrate, you can do that here.
Alerts you when your sensor readings are going down quickly.

Typically taken when dosing for meals or corrections.

How to turn off battery optimizing:

1. Tap Open Phone Settings below.
2. Turn off battery optimizing.
1. Tap Open Phone Settings" below. 2. Find "Battery usage". 3. Set battery usage to "Unrestricted". 4. Tap the Back button to return."

1. Tap Open Phone Settings below.
2. Turn off battery optimizing.

"Because Notifications are Off, alerts won't show on your phone. Urgent Low and Sensor Failed will sound but other alerts may not."

1. Tap Open Phone Settings below.
2. Tap Notifications.
3. Turn on Notification.
"Because you changed the phone's time, your app stopped working correctly."

"Connect your phone to the Internet. When connected, the issue should resolve immediately.

To prevent the app time issue, don't change the phone's time when not connected to the Internet."

Your sensor is now warming up.

"Your Dexcom country of residence is different from your phone's location.
You must resolve this with Dexcom technical support to continue."
Tap here to contact Dexcom technical support.

"Make sure your phone is connected to the internet and try again.
Dexcom needs the internet to confirm your phone's compatibility."
Your account profile lists your Country of Residence (COR) as %1$s, and your app will display your sensor readings in %2$s.

Glucose Management Indicator (GMI) is calculated using your average sensor glucose data. GMI can be an indicator of how well you are managing your glucose levels. Your GMI will likely differ from your A1C. Go to your product instructions for more information.
"2. Go to storage in your phone settings "
Google Fit tracks your activities and gathers data from other devices and apps so you see all your health stats in one place.
To view the details, open Google Fit app.

"Your G7 sensor lasts for 10 days.
In case you need more time to replace your sensor, we give you an extra 12 hour grace period. Your system works exactly as it did during your sensor session."
Grace period expired. No readings or alerts until you start a new sensor.
Please help us to improve our products. Why did you stop early?

Rub patch with oil before removing it. Use any oil meant for skin, like baby oil. Check oil manufacturer warnings.

"Calibrating is optional. Use it to move your sensor reading closer to your BG meter value.
To get an accurate BG meter value, follow these steps:
1. Wash your hands with soap and water 2. Dry your hands 3. Take a fingerstick
If you want to calibrate, enter the BG meter value within 5 minutes.
Your sensor readings come from different fluids than your BG meter values, so they won’t usually match. Neither number is as accurate as the lab test your doctor does."
For more information on comparing your sensor reading with your BG meter value, go to

Location permission is for system setup only. Dexcom doesn't track your location.

You can continue to set up the app. Once set up, you will get sensor readings and alerts.
You can continue to set up the app.

To sync your data with Clarity and tech support, you need to be logged in."
Click on Log in Now and re-enter your password. To use Share, you need to log in to your Dexcom account.
Typically taken once or twice a day, no matter when you eat.

Notifications must be on for you to get all your alerts.
The number in the circle is your most recent reading.

The number in the circle is your most recent sensor reading. It updates every 5 minutes.
"The trend arrow shows where your glucose is going and how fast. It's based on your last few readings."
The black dots to the left show the last 3 hours of sensor readings.
Your most recent sensor reading is here - the white dot on the far right side of your graph.
No trend. Use blood glucose meter (BG meter) for treatment decisions.
Your recent sensor readings are also on your graph.
The gray rectangle shows where you want your glucose to be or your target range.
Sends sensor readings from sensor to your phone
Dexcom ONE offers alerts that let you know when your glucose has gone too high, low or when sensor readings are temporarily unavailable.

"High: %1$s %2$s Low: %3$s %4$s
You can customize these in Profile > Alerts."
"We imported your alert settings. These include:"

"G7 needs your permission to sound when your device is on the most restrictive Do Not Disturb setting.
1. Tap "Allow Access" Below 2. Find Dexcom G7 app 3. Allow Do not Disturb Access 4. Tap Back to Return to app "
Without Do Not Disturb access, you won’t get alerts if the most restrictive Do Not Disturb is on.
Must Allow Do Not Disturb Access
Do Not Disturb Access is On
You will hear alerts even if most restrictive Do Not Disturb setting is on.
Age 2 years (24 months) - 6 years: Use back of upper arm or upper buttocks
Age 2 years (24 months) - 6 years: Use back of upper arm, upper buttocks, or abdomen

"The longer you keep the patch dry and sweat-free in the first 12 hours, the longer it may stick to your skin.
When it gets wet, gently pat it dry as soon as you can.
If it peels off your skin, trim the peeled parts and put on medical tape."
(If worn on sites not listed below, sensor may not work as expected. Talk to your healthcare provider about the best site for you.)
IMPORTANT! If you wore G6 sensors on your abdomen, wear G7 sensors on the back of your upper arm. Children ages 2–6 years can also use their upper buttocks.
Age 7 years and older: Use back of upper arm
Age 7 years and older: Use back of upper arm or abdomen

We’ll show you how to use the applicator to insert the built-in sensor under your skin"
"

"Don't ignore your symptoms, treat with your BG meter."
"If you're missing either a number or trend arrow, ""don't treat using your system."
"For example, maybe you're exercising and start to feel dizzy, but your sensor reading is in your target range with a steady arrow."

"a. Save applicator because you'll need its pairing code "

After you insert the sensor, you must apply the overpatch to keep the sensor on your body.
You must have both a sensor reading and a trend arrow to use your system to treat.
"b. Press and hold applicator firmly against skin until clear safety guard is pushed in. Then push button on side of applicator."
"Use your BG meter to treat when how you feel doesn't match your sensor reading."
"a. Carefully pull off both clear liners, one at a time. Don't touch white adhesive area."
"b. Use colored tab to place overpatch around sensor."
"d. Use tab to peel off colored liner."
The overpatch helps keep the sensor on your skin. Find the overpatch bundled with the instructions in the sensor box.
You must apply the overpatch to keep the sensor on your body. It’s bundled with the instructions in the sensor box.
"a. Wash hands with soap and water. Dry."

"Don't wear your G7 during MRI or diathermy treatment.
You can get a CT scan if the sensor is covered with a lead apron and isn't in the scanned area."

In your app, you’ll see your sensor reading, trend arrow, and graph.

You successfully paired. Open your app to start your session.

"Because Notifications are off, you won't get alerts."

How to turn off background restriction:

1. Tap Open Phone Settings below.
2. Tap Notifications.
3. Turn on Notification.

"Quickly change your alerts to be more discreet. These override your phone sound setting. You still see alerts on your phone's lock screen and in the app."
"All alerts, including Urgent Low and Sensor Fail, won't sound or vibrate. You can set Silence All for up to %1$s."
All alerts, including Urgent Low and Sensor Fail, will not sound or vibrate.

"All alerts vibrate. You can set vibrate mode for up to 6 hours or indefinitely.
For safety, Urgent Low and Sensor Fail are different. They vibrate first, but will sound if you haven't acknowledged them within 20 minutes."

"All alerts vibrate. You can set vibrate mode for up to 6 hours or indefinitely.
For safety, Urgent Low and Sensor Fail are different. They vibrate first, but will sound if you haven't acknowledged them."
"All alerts will only vibrate. Unless acknowledged, after 20 minutes Urgent Low and Sensor Fail sound and vibrate."

To release the transmitter, snap the latch on the holder by pressing down on the lip at the bottom of the latch.
d. Remove applicator from skin leaving patch and holder on.

To remove sensor, peel off patch from the edge. When you peel off the adhesive, the sensor, transmitter holder and transmitter will all be removed. Do not remove the transmitter from the holder until all components have been removed from your body.
Peel off patch from the edge.
To remove sensor, peel off patch from the edge.
Peel off patch from the edge.
Remove the transmitter by pulling it straight out of the holder. Keep the transmitter to use again in your next sensor session.
Replace your sensor now. No readings or alerts until you start a new sensor.

Dexcom ONE offers alerts that let you know when your glucose has gone too high, low or when sensor readings are temporarily unavailable.
These are your default alert settings. You can change them later in Settings > Alerts. If your settings were imported, confirm them in Settings > Alerts.
Glucose alerts let you know when your glucose has gone too high or low.
By default, alerts are turned off.
To turn on alerts, go to:
Yellow Line: Where you set your High alert.
Red Line: Where you set your Low alert
The trend arrow shows the direction your glucose is going and how fast.

"Alerts you when the app temporarily stops getting readings from the sensor because there's an issue with the Bluetooth connection."

Always keep phone within %1$s of transmitter. Wait up to 30 minutes.
Always keep phone within %1$s of sensor. Wait up to 30 minutes.
If Signal Loss continues for more than 30 minutes, contact technical support. Go to Profile > Contact
Signal Loss" tells you that you've lost your Bluetooth connection and aren't getting sensor readings."
Turn Bluetooth off. Then turn it back on and leave it on.
Keep your phone within %1$s of the sensor with nothing between them, including your body, walls, and water.
Keep your phone on the same side of your body as your sensor. Bluetooth works best when the sensor and phone are in sight of each other.
"Keep the app open. Don't swipe it closed."
Restart your phone and the app.
Use recommended phone settings listed in the app at Profile > Phone Settings
Keep your phone charged to at least 20%.

Signal Loss and Brief Sensor Issue alerts

Take these steps to fix:"
1. Delete G7 app: Delete or disable apps on Android
2. Tap to go to Google Play Store.
To prevent this from happening again, don't download the app from anywhere but the Google Play Store.
3. Download the G7 app.
4. Open app and follow on screen instructions to set up"

Replace G7 app now"
Until you replace the app, use your BG meter to treat. Don't remove your sensor."

Until you replace the app, use your BG meter to treat. Don't remove your sensor."

Tap below, then enter the pairing code on the applicator.
Target Range represents your goal for glucose readings. It is shown as a gray rectangle on the glucose graph.
If your trend dots are above or below the gray area, you are outside of your target range during that time.
Target range is %1$s, and cannot be changed
Target Range is set at %1$s and cannot be changed.
Alerts you when you’re not getting sensor readings. They include App Stopped, Replace Sensor Now, and similar alerts.
Technical alerts let you know when you’re not getting sensor readings. They include App Stopped, Replace Sensor Now, and similar alerts. Technical alerts are always On.

"Technical Alerts can’t be turned off, but you can choose how your alert notifies you.
%1$s"

Alerts you when your sensor reading will be %1$s %2$s or below in less than 20 minutes.
"After you acknowledge your first alert, it repeats if your sensor reading stays in the urgently low soon state for this long. This setting can't be changed."
